definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: But even so, FIM's revenue engine is just warming up.
sentences.chinese: 但FIM的营收机器还刚刚进入预热阶段。

sentences.english: That's 1% of Apple's operating income over that time, Munster estimates.
sentences.chinese: Munster估计这只是苹果这段时间营收的1%。

sentences.english: Follow up on sales leads and business quoted to ensure business is secured.
sentences.chinese: 跟踪掌握销售机会及报价确保最大营收价值。

sentences.english: Revenue from the 381 stores is not counted in GOME's annual revenue.
sentences.chinese: 这381家门店的收入并不计入国美的年营收中。

sentences.english: The Effect of Internet Application on the Hotel … Lecturer, Department of Hospitality Management, Diwan University …
sentences.chinese: 运用网际网路在台湾旅馆营收管理之影响效果。

sentences.english: This has caused Apple to become more conservative regarding its revenue next quarter.
sentences.chinese: 这让苹果对于下季的营收估计趋于保守。

sentences.english: Youku’s revenues in the first nine months of this year rose 135 per cent compared with the same period in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 优酷网在今年头9个月的营收同比增长135%。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
